Posts.Content: Hi Jan, What a shock for you, it just shows we are at the mercy of the experts hoping they get it right. Can appreciate why your daughter is still angry, the journey is hard enough.
Posts.Title: Wrong cancer entered on my file

Posts.Content: Should we automatically get a copy of our path reports.? I don't , was told I had grade 2 invasive ductal cancer , had WLE and ANC but no mention regarding hormone receptors. Waiting for results of op, do I find out then or should I have been told after biopsy results. There are so many things I don't know about yet, thank goodness for all you more experienced ladies on the site.
Posts.Title: Wrong cancer entered on my file

Posts.Content: I've recently received my treatment plan, surgery on Saturday for WLE and ANC as the cancer has spread to my lymph nodes. This will be followed by 6 sessions of chemo, 3 weeks of radio and medication for 5years. I too was scared and wary about the spread but it does seem to be quite common. It's a scary journey and we are only at the begining.
Posts.Title: Micromets

Posts.Content: Hi, My consultant has spoken about putting me tamoxifen, waiting for op at the moment, does everybody put on weight with this or can you actually loose. Also are there any alternatives or do you have do go with what's recommended, sorry but this is all new to me and still comming to terms with it all.
Posts.Title: how to lose weight on tamoxifen

Posts.Content: Jellytot, Just read your info, it's really good and will be a big help.. Iam waiting for biopsy results to see if I have op or chemo first.
Posts.Title: Chemotherapy Tips

Posts.Content: Hi lyndasten, ANC is auxiliary node clearance, it's when they remove all your lymph nodes, I had that op 4 weeks ago Xx
Posts.Title: Well didn't expect those results

Posts.Content: Hi Jean, Iam totally in the same situation as you. Losing my hair is completely freaking me out and I feel so angry when people say its ok your hair will grow back. I feel my identity is being taken away and I have no control, my hair is me and Iam not going to be me any more it's a horrible feeling. The thing is we do have to deal with this and I have a wig fitting tomorrow so Iam going to make sure I get a wig which Iam really comfortable with because its going to be my safety net for a while until I get some confidence back. Big hugs xx
Posts.Title: New to all this

Posts.Content: Hi Sheila, May have one useful info for you, used to work in Financial Services, can I pm you Xx
Posts.Title: Insurance claims

Posts.Content: Hi Jackie, Can sympathise with ou, I start my chemo on 2nd April fec -t 6x 3wks then 3 weeks of rads. The unknown is the scary thing I think, I've read all the useful info on this site so far and drawn from people's experiences. The thing is to go into it with an open mind because everybody is different. My problem is I haven't felt ill so really couldn't take it in that I had cancer but once the chemo starts its ok this is it. Try and keep positive we'll get through with the help of all the lovely ladies on here xx
Posts.Title: nervous about starting chemo

Posts.Content: Hi Julie, know what you are going through, I was diagnosed last week. Waiting on biopsy results to see whether I get chemo or operation first. Try to be positive, I know mine is treatable and been caught early even though its spread to lymph nodes so I just want to get treatment started as I expect you do. I find that if I keep talking about it and reading all the info the hospital gave me helps.
Posts.Title: Newly diagnosed - feeling lost

Posts.Content: Hi Janet There are a few Scottish ladies in here, unfortunately Iam quite far away from you, I live in Elgin. It's great to keep in touch and draw inspiration from all these lovely ladies on here. Iam 4weeks post op and starting chemo on 2nd April, where are you on this scary rollercoaster? Take care xx
Posts.Title: Any Scottish ladies out there?

Posts.Content: What a journey you've both been on. Iam just beginning the ride. My op is scheduled for a week Saturday, lumpectomy and axiliary node clearance to be followed by chemo and radio, your post has certainly given me some much needed inspiration.
Posts.Title: Turning Corners and a Bit of Inspiration :-)

Posts.Content: Hi Patsy, Try taking little baby steps slowly one at a time, do what you feel and if you are struggling a bit, come on here for a rant, or like me curl up on the couch with a blanket remote control and some chocolate. We all have blips things will get better, Stay strong Amber xxx
Posts.Title: feeling alone

Posts.Content: Hi Patsy, Sometimes people don't know what to say as they don't want to upset you, I found that if I started talking about cancer then it made it easier for them. My biggy was my Mum, she tip toed around me and wouldn't mention the word cancer, she seemed to think I was incapable of doing the normal routine things overnight. It's hard for friends and family too, but this site is amazing it has helped me tremendously so say whatever you like on here , we're all here for you Big hugs Amber xx
Posts.Title: feeling alone
